data.subject: ComfyUI-ngrok
data.question: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-ngrok?
data.answer: ComfyUI-ngrok is used to enable external access to ComfyUI through ngrok.

data.subject: ComfyUI-ngrok
data.question: How is ComfyUI-ngrok installed?
data.answer: ComfyUI-ngrok is installed by cloning the repository using `git clone https://github.com/pkpkTech/ComfyUI-ngrok` in the ComfyUI custom nodes directory and then using `pip install -r requirements.txt` in the ComfyUI-ngrok directory.

data.subject: ComfyUI-ngrok
data.question: What should be done to the __init__.py file in the ComfyUI-ngrok directory?
data.answer: The __init__.py file should be opened in a text editor and on line 12, replace None with your ngrok AuthToken before saving.

data.subject: ComfyUI-ngrok
data.question: How will I know if the setup of ComfyUI-ngrok is successful?
data.answer: If the setup is successful, you will find the URL in the console when you start ComfyUI.

data.subject: ComfyUI-ngrok
data.question: What can I do if ComfyUI-ngrok is not working as expected?
data.answer: Adding `--enable-cors-header` to the ComfyUI execution argument may help if ComfyUI-ngrok is not working.
